intro: Malesherbia subalpina, commonly known as the alpine malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. This species is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
